verses.verse: “Though (Ps. 139:8; Jer. 23:24) they dig into hell, From there My hand shall take them; (Job 20:6; Jer. 51:53; Obad. 4; Matt. 11:23) Though they climb up to heaven, From there I will bring them down;

And though they (Jer. 23:24) hide themselves on top of Carmel, From there I will search and take them; Though they hide from My sight at the bottom of the sea, From there I will command the serpent, and it shall bite them;

Though they go into captivity before their enemies, From there (Lev. 26:33) I will command the sword, And it shall slay them. (Lev. 17:10; Jer. 21:10; 39:16; 44:11) I will set My eyes on them for harm and not for good.”

The Lord GOD of hosts, He who touches the earth and it (Ps. 104:32; 144:5; Is. 64:1; Mic. 1:4) melts, (Amos 8:8) And all who dwell there mourn; All of it shall swell like the River, And subside like the River of Egypt.

He who builds His (Ps. 104:3, 13) layers in the sky, And has founded His strata in the earth; Who (Amos 5:8) calls for the waters of the sea, And pours them out on the face of the earth— (Amos 4:13; 5:27) The LORD is His name.

“Are you not like the people of Ethiopia to Me, O children of Israel?” says the LORD. “Did I not bring up Israel from the land of Egypt, The (Jer. 47:4) Philistines from (Deut. 2:23) Caphtor, And the Syrians from (Amos 1:5) Kir?

“Behold, (Jer. 44:27; Amos 9:4) the eyes of the Lord GOD are on the sinful kingdom, And I (Jer. 5:10; 30:11; (Joel 2:32); Amos 3:12; (Obad. 16, 17)) will destroy it from the face of the earth; Yet I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob,” Says the LORD.
“For surely I will command, And will sift the house of Israel among all nations, As grain is sifted in a sieve; ((Is. 65:8-16)) Yet not the smallest grain shall fall to the ground.
All the sinners of My people shall die by the sword, ((Is. 28:15); Jer. 5:12; Amos 6:3) Who say, ‘The calamity shall not overtake nor confront us.’

(Israel Will Be Restored) “On (Acts 15:16-18) that day I will raise up The tabernacle of David, which has fallen down, And repair its damages; I will raise up its ruins, And rebuild it as in the days of old;
(Obad. 19) That they may possess the remnant of (Num. 24:18; Is. 11:14) Edom, And all the Gentiles who are called by My name,” Says the LORD who does this thing.

“Behold, (Lev. 26:5) the days are coming,” says the LORD, “When the plowman shall overtake the reaper, And the treader of grapes him who sows seed; (Joel 3:18) The mountains shall drip with sweet wine, And all the hills shall flow with it.

(Ps. 53:6; Is. 60:4; Jer. 30:3, 18) I will bring back the captives of My people Israel; (Is. 61:4) They shall build the waste cities and inhabit them; They shall plant vineyards and drink wine from them; They shall also make gardens and eat fruit from them.
I will plant them in their land, (Is. 60:21; Ezek. 34:28; 37:25) And no longer shall they be pulled up From the land I have given them,” Says the LORD your God.

(The Coming Judgment on Edom) The vision of Obadiah. Thus says the Lord GOD (Is. 21:11; Ezek. 25:12; Joel 3:19; Mal. 1:3) concerning Edom (Jer. 49:14-16; Obad. 1-4) (We have heard a report from the LORD, And a messenger has been sent among the nations, saying, “Arise, and let us rise up against her for battle”):
“Behold, I will make you small among the nations; You shall be greatly despised.

The (Is. 16:6; Jer. 49:16) pride of your heart has deceived you, You who dwell in the clefts of the rock, Whose habitation is high; (Is. 14:13-15; Rev. 18:7) You who say in your heart, ‘Who will bring me down to the ground?’
(Job 20:6) Though you ascend as high as the eagle, And though you (Hab. 2:9; Mal. 1:4) set your nest among the stars, From there I will bring you down,” says the LORD.

“If (Jer. 49:9) thieves had come to you, If robbers by night— Oh, how you will be cut off!— Would they not have stolen till they had enough? If grape-gatherers had come to you, (Deut. 24:21) Would they not have left some gleanings?
“Oh, how Esau shall be searched out! How his hidden treasures shall be sought after!

All the men in your confederacy Shall force you to the border; (Jer. 38:22) The men at peace with you Shall deceive you and prevail against you. Those who eat your bread shall lay a trap for you. (Is. 19:11; Jer. 49:7) No one is aware of it.
